title: Big Brother 2020: Ex-winner Reggie Bird issues a warning to producers
text:
She rose to fame after winning Big Brother in 2003.

And on Friday, Reggie Bird warned producers that the upcoming revival of the show will only be successful if Gretel Killeen returns as host.

She told News.com.au: 'You've got to have Gretel. She is the mother of Big Brother.'

Word of advice! On Friday, Reggie Bird (pictured) warned producers that the upcoming revival of Big Brother will only be successful if Gretel Killeen returns as host

She added: 'If you're going to bring it back you should have Gretel as host and Mike Goldman back doing the voice-overs as well.'

Gretel, 56, hosted Big Brother for seven seasons before being replaced by Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson in 2008.

Reggie added that producers should also consider inviting old housemates back on the show, admitting she would 'do it again in a heartbeat.'

Will she return? 'You've got to have Gretel. She is the mother of Big Brother,' said Reggie. Pictured: Gretel Killeen hosting Big Brother on July 21, 2003

'I reckon they should do an All Stars version and bring back all the favourites and the villains... that would be good,' she said.

It was confirmed earlier this week that Big Brother Australia will be returning for a new season in 2020.

According to TV Blackbox, Channel Seven plans to finance the show using the budget originally allocated for Sunday Night.

Flashback! Reggie rose to fame after winning Big Brother in 2003. Pictured on July 21, 2003

The network's current affairs flagship was officially cancelled on Wednesday after months of lacklustre ratings.

Endemol Shine has opened applications for Big Brother 2020 and potential housemates can apply online.

Big Brother famously launched the careers of Chrissie Swan (season three), Ryan 'Fitzy' Fitzgerald (season four) and Blair McDonough (season one).
